brief.brief: The Join command panel does a relational database join on two tables.
For example, you could combine two tables into a single table based on a related set of fields.

detail.detail: First Source File: (file variable) Specify the first file variable from which you are extracting information.
Second Source File: (file variable) Specify the second file variable from which you are extracting information.

Join Expression: (Boolean) Specify an expression that determines which pairs of records to extract from both tables. The join routine checks all pairs of records from both tables against this expression.
Target File: (file variable) Specify the file variable in which to deposit the information extracted from the source files.
Exit if No Records in Join: (label) Specify the exit to take if there are no records in the join.
The join routine checks all pairs of records extracted from the first and second file variables against the join expression.
When Service Manager performs a join, it fills a third file variable with the fields in the two tables it joined.
